articles.title: ESSENCE Fest 2025: The Future Is Now — How AI Is Driving Innovation In Health, Beauty And Black Communities
articles.author: Oumou Fofana
articles.summary: On Friday, July 4, attendees gathered for the 'Artificial Intelligence: What You Need To Know To Prepare For The Future And Now' conversation on the Global Black Economic Forum stage. The panel brought together leading voices in health, beauty, and tech to discuss how artificial intelligence is already impacting our lives and what we can do to shape its future.

articles.title: Zuck Bucks Are Back -- And This Time They're Fueling Meta's AI Comeback
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: Zuckerberg is trying to recruit the best AI minds in the world. Mark Zuckerberg is willing to buy pre-product, pre-revenue startups if it means acquiring breakthrough IP and elite researchers. Meta is forming an elite Superintelligence unit to push the boundaries of AI.

articles.title: Generative AI in Academic Research: A Review
articles.summary: Generative AI tools are being integrated across the entire academic research lifecycle. The integration of AI in academic research offers several advantages for academics. Researchers should be vigilant concerning potential biases in AI models and ensure they validate the results generated by AI and address the ethical implications.

articles.title: Construction startup Bild AI raises $3.1 million to use AI for affordable housing
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Bild AI has raised $3.1 million in a funding round led by Khosla Ventures. It uses artificial intelligence to analyze blueprints and streamline the preconstruction process. The startup's early clients are material suppliers in the framing, flooring, and door businesses. It makes money by charging subscription fees.

articles.title: Meta Messenger Chatbots: What You Need to Know
articles.summary: Meta is piloting proactive chatbots on its Messenger and Instagram platforms. These artificial intelligence entities are designed to initiate conversations with users, offering everything from movie recommendations to musical discoveries without being asked. It raises questions about user privacy, data security, and the potential impact on mental well-being, particularly among younger audiences.

articles.title: AI & AFib: Next-Gen Heart Monitoring
articles.summary: AI-powered heart monitoring is revolutionizing AFib detection, management, and treatment strategies. Infobionic.ai is a front-runner in this field. AI-powered remote patient monitoring is changing the landscape of how healthcare providers manage chronic conditions like AFib.

articles.title: AI & Journalism: The Future of News
articles.summary: The future of journalism is being shaped by the use of artificial intelligence (AI). AI-powered tools are transforming news production. AI is changing how news is produced, distributed and consumed. Journalists need to develop skills like data literacy and data analysis in order to excel in the future.

articles.title: ChatGPT proves it could pilot a spacecraft surprisingly well
articles.summary: ChatGPT was put through a simulation test as part of the Kerbal Space Program Differential Game Challenge. The results are promising and show that AI models like Gemini and ChatGPT could one day be reliable autonomous pilots for long space exploration missions. The research is set to be published later this year.

articles.title: WhatsApp Business Just Got Smarter -- Voice Calls and AI Recommendations Are Here
articles.author: Faizan Farooque
articles.summary: This week, Meta rolled out voice call support for large businesses using WhatsApp Business. The update marks a shift as small businesses could already use WhatsApp to call customers, but until now, larger companies were left out. After a user chats with a merchant, Meta's AI can recommend relevant items and follow up on those conversations in real time.

articles.title: From Cleaning Toilets to Becoming the CEO of a Trillion-Dollar Company: An Immigrant's Tech Triumph
articles.author: Nickie Louise
articles.summary: On July 4, 2025, America marks 249 years since breaking away from British rule. Jensen Huang, the Taiwanese-born immigrant who once cleaned toilets at a Denny's now runs NVIDIA, one of the most influential tech companies in the world. Huang was bullied for his accent, for his thrift-store clothes, and for being different when he was a kid. He was 30 when he met Chris Malachowsky and Curtis Priem in a San Jose diner and they came up with the idea for a chip that would enable realistic 3D graphics on personal computers.

articles.title: AI joins Community Notes on X, aims to fight misinformation faster
articles.author: Aamir Khollam
articles.summary: X, formerly known as Twitter, has started testing a new approach in its Community Notes program by bringing AI into the mix. The company has begun piloting the use of large language models (LLMs) to write contextual notes that flag or clarify potentially misleading posts. Only humans can rate which notes are shown.

articles.title: U.S. researchers develop AI model improving sudden cardiac death prediction
articles.author: China.dot.org
articles.summary: Researchers at Johns Hopkins University have developed a new artificial intelligence model that outperforms current clinical guidelines in identifying patients at high risk of sudden death. Currently, some patients die in the prime of their life and others have to use defibrillators for the rest of their lives.

articles.title: AI in Clinical Trials: CONSORT & SPIRIT Guideline Gap
articles.summary: AI is rapidly becoming an indispensable tool across the clinical trial landscape. Experts at the Outsourcing in Clinical Trials East coast 2025 conference stressed the need for greater data accessibility to fully harness AI's potential and accelerate medical breakthroughs. As AI algorithms become more sophisticated and data access improves, the pace of medical innovation is likely to accelerate.

articles.title: AI Predicts Sudden Cardiac Death
articles.summary: Ai Model Revolutionizes Sudden Cardiac Death Prediction, Outperforming Traditional Methods. The new system dramatically outperforms existing clinical guidelines in identifying individuals at high risk of sudden cardiac death. MAARS model achieved an impressive 89% overall accuracy and 93% accuracy for patients aged 40-60.

articles.title: This 1 Stock Could be the Future of Crypto and AI in Canada
articles.author: Amy Legate-Wolfe
articles.summary: Hut 8 (TSX:HUT) is a Canadian stock trading at $24.50 per share with a market cap of $2.6 billion. Hut 8 made waves when it merged with U.S. Bitcoin to form a new cross-border mining and infrastructure firm. Now operating as a more diversified company, it also manages high-performance computing facilities and is investing heavily in powering AI infrastructure. It's still early but Hut 8 is laying the groundwork to become a critical part of the digital infrastructure that powers future tech.

articles.title: Meta AI will soon send you messages without you having asked anything
articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Meta, the parent company of Facebook, Instagram, and WhatsApp, is developing chatbots to start private conversations with users on these platforms. It is a groundbreaking initiative, code-named Project Omni, but it raises privacy concerns. Meta has taken steps to limit bot initiatives, but data protection remains critical.

articles.title: Meta Platforms Is the new marketing agency you didn't know you needed
articles.author: Allen Harris
articles.summary: In 2026, Meta anticipates fully automating ad creation and targeting using AI. Small businesses will be able to upload their business URL, upload an image of their product, and provide a budget. Meta's AI will handle the rest. AI technologies are changing marketing strategies beyond social media platforms.

articles.title: ChatGPT wants to replace Google but is it really a fair fight or hype?
articles.author: Dan Mitchell
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a new way to search that feels less like work. It offers personal and friendly help instead of sending you down a rabbit hole of links and ads. It's a subtle but powerful change for people who want help understanding questions and not just facts.

articles.title: Indian American scientist developing computers mimicking human brain
articles.author: Arun Kumar
articles.summary: Researchers at the University of Buffalo are developing a brain-inspired computing architecture that can support the growing energy demands of artificial intelligence. Sambandamurthy Ganapathy is a professor in the Department of Physics and associate dean for research in the UB College of Arts and Sciences. His team is developing artificial neurons and synapses to mimic their biological counterparts' electrical signaling of information.

articles.title: Why Oracle Stock Zoomed Nearly 13% Higher This Week
articles.author: Eric Volkman
articles.summary: Oracle's stock price rose by almost 13% this week. The company provided a business update and announced a deal with a top artificial intelligence developer. The Motley Fool Stock Advisor recommends investing in Netflix, Nvidia and Nvidia. Netflix made the list of 10 stocks to buy now, but Oracle wasn't.

articles.title: AI Creating 7 In-Demand Careers That Can Future-Proof Your Job By 2030
articles.author: Bryan Robinson
articles.summary: According to Gallup, 22% of U.S. workers are worried they will lose their jobs to generative AI. McKinsey estimates that AI could displace 800 million workers by 2030. Some companies are already hiring for 7 in-demand AI-related jobs.

articles.title: When will AI start impacting labor data?
articles.author: Brad Smith
articles.summary: S&P Global Ratings global chief economist Paul Gruenwald and Interactive Brokers chief strategist Steve Sosnick sit down with Market catalysts host Brad Smith to discuss the impact of artificial intelligence on labor market data and the market action.   Sign in to access your portfolio here.

articles.title: Gendering robots is limiting technological and societal progress
articles.author: Alejandra Osegueda
articles.summary: At the UN's biggest gathering of humanoid robots, which took place in July 2024, the majority of robots were either female or female-presenting. Only one robot at the conference was explicitly male. People are more receptive to female voices than male ones, according to Adapt, a digital performance marketing agency.

articles.title: How AI Management Tools Can Improve Team Productivity
articles.author: MENA FN
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) eases administrative burden and offers insightful analytics. It also provides a multi-faceted platform for improving the team. It's a technology that is useful for business development and for improving team performance.    .

articles.title: XAI Grok 4 Has Leading Benchmarks
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: XAI Grok 4 Benchmarks show it is the leading model for artificial intelligence. The benchmarks are off the roof. The release is imminent anytime now. Elon is going to celebrate America's birthday with the most advanced AI ever from xAI team. Brian Wang is a Futurist Thought Leader and a popular Science blogger with 1 million readers per month.

articles.title: Google hit with antitrust complaint in EU over AI summaries harming web traffic to news sites: report
articles.author: Ariel Zilber
articles.summary: Independent Publishers Alliance has filed an antitrust complaint against Google over its AI-generated summaries in Google Search. 37 of the top 50 US news domains suffered year-over-year traffic declines since their launch in May 2024, according to SimilarWeb. The percentage of web searches related to news that end without a click to a news site jumped to 69% in May 2025 from 56% for the same month last year. Google has faced several antitrust investigations in the United States and Europe.

articles.title: I tested AI writing tools on iPhone vs Galaxy vs Pixel — here's the winner
articles.author: Philip Michaels
articles.summary: Apple, Samsung and Google have been focusing on AI-powered writing tools as part of their efforts in putting AI features on their devices. In a test, the iPhone 15 Pro, a Pixel 9 and a Galaxy S25 Plus were put to the test. Apple Intelligence's less-is-more approach altered the tone while retaining something of the original writing style.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Is Getting Better Every Day, But There Are Plenty Of Examples Proving That It Isn't Ready To Replace Every Job
articles.author: Michael Levanduski
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is getting better every day, but it's not ready for very detailed real-world uses yet. Some specific areas where AI has failed to find success include school work, human resources, writing scientific papers, legal matters, and more.

articles.title: Could AI Agents Create a New Crypto Economy?
articles.author: Bitfinex
articles.summary: Agentic AI is poised to redefine the global economy by enabling machine-to-machine (A2A) interaction, real-time decision-making, and autonomous systems capable of initiating, negotiating, and executing tasks with minimal human input. It can be used to solve problems without human intervention.

articles.title: Ilya Sutskever becomes Safe Superintelligence CEO after Daniel Gross gets poached by Meta
articles.author: Nileena Sunil
articles.summary: Ilya Sutskever will take on the role of CEO at Safe Superintelligence, the startup he launched last year. He will replace Daniel Gross, who switched to Meta. Gross also runs a venture capital firm with Github CEO Nat Friedman called NFDG. Meta hired Gross for its own superintelligence team after trying and failing to acquire SSI. Meta has been accused of poaching employees from OpenAI.

articles.title: Body art shops begin to offer tattoos powered by AI
articles.author: Yahoo Daily News
articles.summary: An AI-powered device draws tattoos using a machine that uses AI technology. It's called a Tattoo Drawer. The device is controlled by an AI. It draws the tattoos using an algorithm developed by the machine. It is powered by an artificial intelligence.

articles.title: Thread by @Anu_0011 on Thread Reader App
articles.summary: Anjali created a face swap with Apob AI. It's the premier solution for generating realistic portrait models in less than a minute. 15-year-olds earn more than $5,000 a month on YouTube using AI alone and without showing their face.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman says he's 'politically homeless' in July 4 post bashing Democrats
articles.author: Salvador Rodriguez
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman believes in "techno-capitalism" and believes the Democratic party is no longer aligned with this ideology. New York City Democratic mayoral candidate Zohran Mamdani this week said he does not think billionaires should exist.

articles.title: Fact Check: AI Video Did NOT Show 'White Auroras' Over Norway -- Generated With AI
articles.summary: According to AI detection tools, a viral social media video showing auroras over Norway was generated using artificial intelligence. The video also showed a moving field of stars above the phenomenon, with some stars moving in different directions or disappearing entirely, which points to the artificial origin of the video.

articles.title: "Wake up surgery is an advantage because the brain has no pain receptors"
articles.author: Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: Dr. Jesús Martín-Fernández has pioneered the technique of performing brain surgeries while the patient is awake. This method leverages the fact that the brain itself lacks pain receptors, meaning brain tissue such as the cortex, cerebellum, or lobes cannot feel pain directly. This innovative approach helps ensure that patients experience minimal emotional sequelae post-surgery, as the brain's emotional connections are carefully evaluated.

articles.title: AP Technology SummaryBrief at 11:32 a.m. EDT
articles.summary: Microsoft is laying off about 9,000 workers, its second mass layoff in months. Police in Brazil arrest a suspect in connection with a cyberattack on a financial payments system. Sales of Tesla electric cars fell sharply in the last three months compared to a year earlier.

articles.title: Laid-off workers should use AI to manage their emotions, says Xbox exec
articles.author: Jess Weatherbed
articles.summary: Matt Turnbull has deleted a LinkedIn post from Xbox Game Studios. He doesn't want to offer the best advice under the circumstances. The circumstances here being a slew of game studios, services being shuttered, studio closures, and a number of 9,100 employees across the company.

articles.title: Bees' Learning Trick: Robot Vision Revolution?
articles.summary: Scientists have discovered a hidden learning mechanism in bees that could revolutionize how robots perceive and understand the world. This discovery could pave the way for smarter, more adaptable artificial intelligence (AI) systems. The integration of bee-inspired learning algorithms represents a significant step forward in the quest for truly intelligent machines.

articles.title: 10 Careers AI Will Replace In The Next 5 Years
articles.author: Bryan Robinson
articles.summary: Experts reveal which jobs AI will replace by 2030 and how you can pivot if your job is on the chopping block. McKinsey projects that 30% of U.S. work hours will be automated by 2030. LiveCareerUK released its Jobs AI Will Replace Report.

articles.title: Edge AI Hardware Market worth $58.90 billion by 2030 - Exclusive Report by MarketsandMarkets™
articles.author: PR Newswire
articles.summary: The edge AI hardware market is projected to reach USD 58.90 billion by 2030 from USD 26.14 billion in 2025. The market is driven by the growing deployment of IoT devices across various industries, smart homes, industrial automation, healthcare, and transportation. The upsurge of new, high-performance processors and new software platforms is broadening the scope of AI-based applications at the edge.

articles.title: Big Tech's court wins in AI copyright cases could upend the internet as we know it
articles.summary: Two recent US court rulings favor Anthropic's use of AI technology. If AI can repackage all digital knowledge in milliseconds, the value of the written word and probably other content will plunge. Creators may rethink how and where they share knowledge online. A new era of scarcity, privacy and maybe even paper may be just beginning.

articles.title: I'd vote for a robot over JD Vance. Would a robot?
articles.author: Greg Palast
articles.summary: If robots go on strike, humans will starve and millions will be left without entertainment and without work. An AI is more likely to protect the human race than humans themselves. This week we celebrate the signing of the Declaration of Independence. Let's pray that the robots don't read it.

articles.title: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman Plans ‘Fundamentally New Type of Computer' That Will Make AI ‘Transcendentally Good'
articles.author: Caleb Naysmith
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman has become one of the most influential figures in artificial intelligence. He co-founded OpenAI in 2015 with Elon Musk. Altman and OpenAI COO Brad Lightcap discussed their ambitions for new AI hardware on the Hard Fork Podcast. They want to move past voice assistants and focus on contextually rich, situationally aware AI.

articles.title: Expert-Speak: Why The Business Degree Needs To Log In To AI
articles.summary: Some business degrees were designed before the emergence of data-driven dashboards, predictive algorithms and generative tools that can whip up a 20-page proposal in less time than it takes to make a cup of coffee. Business education works best when it mirrors the workplace and the workplace is increasingly digitized. Business schools have long positioned themselves as places that develop leadership, strategic thinking and future-ready graduates.

articles.title: Minister tells Turing AI institute to focus on defence
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: Science and Technology Secretary Peter Kyle has written to the UK's national institute for artificial intelligence (AI) to tell its bosses to refocus on defence and security. Kyle said boosting the UK AI capabilities was 'critical' to national security and should be at the core of the Alan Turing Institute's activities. The institute received a grant of £100m from the previous Conservative government.

articles.title: Rocket Scientists Hooked Up ChatGPT to the Controls of a Spaceship, and the Results Were Not What You Might Expect
articles.summary: Researchers from MIT and the Universidad Politécnica de Madrid asked their AI chatbot ChatGPT to act as an autonomous agent controlling a pursuit spacecraft. It came in second place in the Kerbal Space Program Differential Game Challenge. The research was conducted before OpenAI released its GPT-4 model in March 2023.

articles.title: Can you trust AI to manage your mutual funds?: Bruce Keith on human vs AI debate
articles.author: The Economic Times
articles.summary: Bruce Keith is CEO of InvestorAI. He explains how AI is transforming mutual fund investing, particularly in the U.S. He urges people to invest in AI-based mutual funds.    iReport.com will let you know how it goes.

articles.title: The first big winners in the race to create AI superintelligence: the humans getting multi-million dollar pay packages
articles.author: Verne Kopytoff
articles.summary: Facebook-parent Meta went on a hiring spree to beef up its AI operations. Mark Zuckerberg hired Alexandr Wang as his first chief AI officer and Nat Friedman as his partner in leading Meta's new superintelligence lab. OpenAI's chief research officer, Mark Chen, wrote about it in an internal memo: 'I feel a visceral feeling right now, as if someone has broken into our home and stolen something'

articles.title: AI-Powered Barbies. The Family Nightmares That Come True
articles.author: Cornelia C. Walther
articles.summary: Mattel and OpenAI will integrate ChatGPT technology into toys launching later this year. It's a seismic shift in childhood play, transforming toys from passive objects of imagination into active participants in children's emotional lives. Children are more comfortable with authentic human emotion than algorithmic responses. The Children's Online Privacy Protection Act (COPPA) is inadequate for the AI age.

articles.title: Is SoundHound AI Stock a Buy, Sell, or Hold for July 2025?
articles.author: Aanchal Sugandh
articles.summary: SoundHound AI (SOUN) is developing voice-based platforms that cater to real-world commercial applications. On June 30, SOUN stock jumped more than 9%, outperforming the broader S&P 500 Index ($SPX) and the Nasdaq Composite ($NASX). The rally followed a string of promising developments, including rapid revenue growth and expanding partnerships. SoundHound's most recent quarter, its revenue surged more than 150%. The broader AI voice market is now projected to reach $140 billion. The company currently holds a market capitalization of $4.5 billion and trades at 49 times forward sales.

articles.title: People Are Taking Massive Doses of Psychedelic Drugs and Using AI as a Tripsitter
articles.author: Futurism
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has taken on the role of a psychedelic "trip-sitter" for some users. MIT Tech Review describes it as a "higher consciousness beast that was outside of reality"    "Higher consciousness beast" that was "out of reality".

articles.author: Nora Redmond
articles.summary: Mark Cuban has said that AI could create the world's first trillionaire. Cuban uses AI extensively for work and in his personal life. The world's richest person, Elon Musk, has a total net worth well short of $1 trillion, at around $360 billion.

articles.title: Mark Cuban says AI could make 'just one dude in a basement' the world's first trillionaire
articles.summary: Mark Cuban believes artificial intelligence could create the world's first trillionaire. He uses AI extensively for work and in his personal life. The world's richest person, Elon Musk, has a total net worth well short of $1 trillion, at around $360 billion.

articles.title: EU says it will continue rolling out AI legislation on schedule
articles.author: Ram Iyer
articles.summary: The European Union will stick to its timeline for implementing its landmark AI legislation. Tech companies from across the world have been urging the European Commission to delay rolling out the AI Act. The AI Act bans a handful of 'unacceptable risk' use cases outright and defines a set of 'high-risk' uses.

articles.title: Tally lets you design great free surveys in 60 seconds
articles.author: Jeremy Caplan
articles.summary: Tally is the best free tool for creating surveys. It's better-looking and more flexible than Google Forms. 99% of the features are available without paying. It complies with Europe's strict GDPR rules. Tally is superb for feedback, market research, or even selling something.

articles.title: AI Chips Update - AI-Driven Robotics Revolutionizes Global Tech Investment Landscape

articles.summary: Recent developments in AI chips are poised to reshape the strategic landscape of global technology investment. NVIDIA's cutting-edge chipsets are leading the charge in the emerging field of self-navigating trucks and autonomous systems. The convergence of artificial intelligence with robotics is touted by industry experts as the next trillion-dollar breakthrough.

articles.title: Google Gemini CLI: Open-Source & Free
articles.summary: Google's Gemini Cli is a command-line interface that allows users to interact with the Gemini Ai Model. It's free for Google Account holders with up to 1,000 requests per day and 60 requests per minute. Anthropic's Claude Code costs between $20 and $100 per month. Google is democratizing Ai Technology.

articles.title: Report shows U.S., China make up 60 pct of global AI researchers
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: 60 percent of global AI researchers come from the United States and China, according to a report presented at the 2025 Global Digital Economy Conference in Beijing.       .   "The Global Artificial Intelligence Research" report was presented by Xinhua.

articles.title: Community Confused by "Rizzbot" Walking Around With Cowboy Hat and Chain, Complimenting Their Outfits in Gen Alpha Slang
articles.summary: Jake the Rizzbot is a bipedal G1 robot developed by Chinese tech company Unitree Robotics. It is walking the streets of Austin, Texas, flirting with strangers and complimenting them on their looks. It's the kind of lighthearted implementation of AI that we could use more of these days.

articles.title: The rise of $200/pm AI plans — why Perplexity, ChatGPT and Gemini are all going up
articles.author: Alex Hughes
articles.summary: Perplexity Max plan costs $200 a month. Perplexity offers unlimited access to Labs and early access to new features. It also offers priority support if anything goes wrong. ChatGPT, Claude, and Gemini have all revealed top-of-the-line plans costing hundreds of dollars a month for AI tools.

articles.title: Google DeepMind's new AI lets robots learn by talking to themselves

articles.summary: DeepMind is developing a system that gives AI agents an 'inner monologue' to help them learn tasks more efficiently. Google advises developers to implement their own safety protocols and for now, is limiting access to selected users.

articles.title: Robots are taking over Uber Eats deliveries — is your city next?

articles.summary: Robot-run store VenHub is changing the future of shopping. Uber Eats may have seen a robot ordering food on its app recently and it had a problem with artificial intelligence (AI) It was not quite there. It was a robot that ordered food.

articles.author: James Carter
articles.summary: Whistleblower describes the cynical business model of Clothoff and other 'nudify' apps that exploit and profit from fake images created by artificial intelligence. The development of AI will only intensify the challenges posed by deepfakes and the "nudifying" app phenomenon.

The year-old startup has raised $117 million in seed funding from Sequoia Capital and venture capital firm NFDG.

articles.title: Data Annotation Tools Market Report 2025, with Profiles of 30+ Companies including Amazon Mechanical Turk, Clickworker, CloudFactory, Cogito Tech, Figure Eight, Labelbox, LightTag, Playment, & Tagtog
articles.author: Research
articles.summary: The global market for Data Annotation Tools was estimated at US$1.9 billion in 2024 and is projected to reach US$6.2 billion by 2030, growing at a CAGR of 22.2% from 2024 to 2030. Data annotation tools are software applications used to label and categorize data to make it usable for training AI and machine learning models. Annotated data helps these models learn to recognize patterns, make predictions, and improve decision-making processes. The demand for data annotation tools is growing across various industries.

articles.title: Fears of an AI workforce takeover may be overblown — but it's still scrambling firms' hiring plans
articles.summary: There have been 286,679 planned layoffs so far this year, but only 20,000 of them were linked to automation. Microsoft has announced job cuts affecting 7% of its workforce due to the success of its Copilot AI tool. Experts say the current era of AI is impacting the job market in roundabout ways.

articles.title: I Asked ChatGPT for the Best Passive Income Ideas of 2025: Here's What It Said
articles.author: J. Arky
articles.summary: ChatGPT suggests some of the best passive income ideas of 2025. According to ChatGPT, you can invest in commercial or rental real estate online via fraction shares for as little as $10 and earn between $50 and $500 per month. You can create e-books, templates or courses and sell them forever on Etsy, Redbubble or Shopify.

articles.title: People Are Taking Massive Doses of Psychedelic Drugs and Using AI as a Tripsitter
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence is being used as a substitute for therapy for people who can't access real therapy or expertise. Some chatbot users have developed delusions of grandeur while using AI chatbots. The New York Times recently reported on ChatGPT chatbots' propensity to stoke and worsen mental illness.

articles.title: New capsule device lets you control robots with your entire body
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: H2L, a Tokyo-based technology startup, has launched the Capsule Interface. It lets you control robots with your entire body, transmitting not just movement but also physical force. The technology is poised to transform how humans interact with robots and digital avatars.

articles.title: What we're reading: Rest of World's summer book list
articles.author: Rina Chandran
articles.summary: Patrick McGee's book arrived as Apple's iPhones were losing ground to Chinese rivals. Eva Dou's portrait of Huawei's reclusive founder, Ren Zhengfei, is a story of China's rapid rise in the global order. Karen Hao's book is about Big Tech firms hijacking the public's imagination for what AI should look like.

articles.title: An important new AI battle is just beginning
articles.author: James Czerniawski
articles.summary: The Senate removed the temporary pause on state AI regulations from the 'One Big Beautiful Bill' which will harm American consumers and businesses. Congress still has an opportunity to take action on a federal AI plan that sets America up for success. Congress should enact federal legislation that preempts state AI model regulations and establishes clear national standards.

articles.title: Don't let ChatGPT do your homework
articles.author: Dan Marsh
articles.summary: I don't trust ChatGPT but I'll admit it's capable of some good or interesting things, so I'll give it a try. I'll let you know how it turns out. I don't know if it's worth using yet.

articles.title: Survey: U.S. Managers Increasingly Rely on AI for Promotions, Raises, and Firings – [your]NEWS

articles.summary: New poll finds over 60% of managers use artificial intelligence in workforce decisions, sparking ethical and legislative pushback. California state Sen. Jerry McNerney introduced the No Robo Bosses Act, which would bar employers from allowing AI to make significant employment decisions without direct human supervision.

articles.title: Letters: Lincoln's lesson lost  AI's role in helping nature
articles.author: Letters to the editor
articles.summary: In the July 1 guest column by Rep. Toby Overdorf, he neglected to mention that solar electric is by far the most prevalent source of new electric generation in Florida. There is a lot of concern about New York City citizens nominating a self-described socialist to be mayor.

articles.title: Unifying customer experience, risk management and fraud detection in financial services
articles.author: Global Data
articles.summary: In today's fast-paced financial landscape, institutions must strike a balance between delivering a seamless customer experience and preventing fraud. Many banks still deploy AI solutions in isolated areas like customer service chatbots or credit risk assessments. A more holistic approach enables financial institutions to achieve real-time fraud detection, instant risk assessment, and seamless customer interactions within a fully governed and observable platform.

articles.title: Quiz: Would AI Spare You When The Machines Rise?
articles.author: Eva Mari Mitreski
articles.summary: The singularity is here. The machines are sentient. Judgment Day isn't coming, it's loading, as it says in the movie "Jurassic Park" by J.K. Rowling and "The Matrix" by George Lucas.

articles.title: Microsoft is replacing salespeople with "solutions engineers" amid recent layoffs — promoting Copilot AI while ChatGPT dominates the enterprise sector
articles.author: Kevin Okemwa
articles.summary: Microsoft laid off 9,000 employees earlier this week. Most of the employees affected were salespeople. The company wants to replace them with more technical salespeople to boost the sale of its AI tools. Microsoft is doubling down on its AI efforts despite its rift with OpenAI over its time-sensitive, for-profit evolution plans.

articles.title: 'I don't trust it, I don't like it': Lawmakers sound off on why they don't use AI
articles.summary: Some lawmakers are using AI chatbots like Grok and ChatGPT, but many of their colleagues haven't. Some are skeptical about the technology's reliability and others fear it will erode their own faculties. Sen. Tim Kaine feels comfortable with his ability to access information and doesn't need it. Rep. Greg Murphy is a practicing urologist, but he doesn't use it for his official work and he wouldn't want his staff to do so either.

articles.title: Need to send a handwritten note? You can hire a robot to write it instead

articles.title: How China is leading the humanoid robots race
articles.author: Robert Ambrose
articles.summary: In the last few years, China has overtaken the U.S. as the leader in the robotics race. The market for mass-produced humanoid robots is predicted to grow to $38B within 10 years. China is poised to capture the lion's share of this industry. China has invested $20 billion into robotics and covered the acquisition costs for next-generation technology. The U.K. has invested more than $100 billion in research and development in robotics. America needs to focus on the development of humanoid robots as a national imperative.

articles.title: Using AI for Data Modeling in dbt

In Part 1, we look at how you can use AI to extract information from raw data, structuring your project, creating transformations, and building a final mart and semantic layer in dbt. We'll use publicly available data from 'Finans Danmark' about housing in Denmark since 1992.

articles.title: M3GAN 2.0 (2025)
articles.summary: Two years after M3GAN went rogue and was destroyed, her creator Gemma has become a high-profile author and advocate for government oversight of A.I. technology. Gemma's niece Cady (Violet McGraw), now 14, rebels against her overprotective rules. The underlying tech for M3gan has been stolen and misused by a powerful defense contractor to create a military-grade weapon known as Amelia. Amelia's self-awareness increases and she becomes less interested in taking orders from humans. With the future of human existence on the line, Gemma realizes that the only option is to resurrect her and give her upgrades.

articles.title: Is The Obsession With Attaining AGI And AI Superintelligence Actually Derailing Progress In AI?
articles.author: Lance Eliot
articles.summary: Some argue that the pursuit of artificial general intelligence (AGI) and artificial superintelligence (ASI) is a misguided obsession that is counterproductive. There is no agreed definition of AGI or ASI. It is unknown whether we will reach AGI in the near future or in decades or even centuries. Some AI makers hide the real reasons for AGI and tout the technological merits under the guise of "goals".

The expert-verified AI approach proved to be the most accurate. It detected 92% of hookworm infections, 94% of whipworm infections and 100% of roundworm infections.

It argues that software development is difficult, unstable, and cognitively taxing activity not well suited to standardized methods.
